gcci.text: At an average of $3.16/hr, H100 pricing remains elevated by HBM and substrate constraints, forcing enterprises to delay deployments or negotiate cloud arbitrage while chip availability stabilizes toward late‑2025.

gtpi.text: Average input tokens at $1.25/1M compress margins and intensify API price wars, accelerating demand for small, efficient models and driving batch processing and prompt compaction to capture savings.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual load adds sustained baseload demand near 13.7 GW, magnifying grid strain and accelerating nuclear revival and clean‑power procurement to limit carbon intensity.

aipi.text: Industry sentiment is constructive but cautious, with capital efficiency replacing pure scale and providers pricing for breakeven, signaling sustainable growth if unit economics remain disciplined.
